name: House Nodlock
description: A small south-western barony centered on Nodding Castle. Lord Harald Nodlock is slovenly and wine-soaked, and is widely said to be a lackey of Lord Ramius—trading obedience for protection.

enclaves.name: Nodding Castle
enclaves.role: Moated keep; home of Lord Nodlock.

resources.name: Wine Cellars
resources.description: Harald’s stores of wine and the coin spent to replenish them.

resources.name: Small Household Guard
resources.description: A modest guard force—more for show than war.

resources.name: Rod of the Wyrd
resources.description: A strange rod kept close by Harald; its true power is best handled via oracle.

resources.name: Hidden Coffers
resources.description: Caches of coin stashed away in and around Nodding Castle.

resources.name: Ramius’s Patronage
resources.description: Protection granted (and demanded) by Lord Ramius.

goals.name: Stay Alive and in Power
goals.notes: Avoid provoking stronger neighbours; keep the household intact.

goals.name: Appease Lord Ramius
goals.notes: Send gifts, intel, and small favors to maintain Ramius’s patronage.

goals.name: Protect the Treasury
goals.notes: Hide reserves and avoid ducal collectors or opportunistic raiders.

goals.name: Avoid Scandal and Attention
goals.notes: Keep the barony quiet; suppress rumours that could draw the duke’s wrath.

on_complete.reason: Harald’s gifts and obedience improve relations for a time.

on_complete.text: A wine-laden cart leaves Nodding Castle under guard, bound for Lord Ramius.
Servants are seen hauling chests at night; the castle’s wealth becomes harder to trace.
New hard-eyed bravos appear at Nodding Castle, demanding respect (and payment).
Officials leave Nodding Castle smiling and slightly heavier of purse.

lord_harald_nodlock.name: Lord Harald Nodlock
lord_harald_nodlock.summary: A slovenly human man in his mid-fifties, of
lord_harald_nodlock.demeanour: Presents himself as battle-hardened and iron-willed, but is a coward and has never seen combat. Drunk at almost any time of day. Flies into a rage at any mention of his neighbour, Lord Murkin (p65), who threatens Nodlock’s northern border.
lord_harald_nodlock.speech: Gruff drawl, accompanied with frequent belching and spittle spray. (It is advisable not to sit too close to Lord Nodlock when he speaks.) Woldish, Old Woldish.
lord_harald_nodlock.desires: Nodlock is a simple man: he desires little beyond fine wine, fine food, and fine women, spiced with the occasional amusing execution.
lord_harald_nodlock.possessions: The Rod of the Wyrd—a melodramatically named heirloom of House Nodlock. What it lacks in occult power, the rod makes up for in mundane value: it is set with diamonds to the value of 10,000gp.
lord_harald_nodlock.family: Happily unmarried. Has many illegitimate children, but no heir.Servants: A retinue of sycophants and advisors who oversee the castle and borders during Nodlock’s frequent alcohol-induced slumbers. A poorly trained standing army. Groundsmen, cooks, butlers, librarians, etc.

structure.notes: Harald’s court is disorderly, wine-soaked, and fearful of stronger powers.
Servants and a small guard keep the estate functioning—barely.
Ramius’s influence shapes decisions; many actions are taken to appease him.

domains.name: Barony of Nodlock
domains.notes: A small pocket of pasture and woodland at the far south-western tip of Dolmenwood.

oracle_hooks.wyrd_rod_effect: Use oracle/adjudication to determine if/when Harald’s rod manifests supernatural effects.
oracle_hooks.ramius_demands: Use oracle to generate new demands from Ramius when Nodlock appears weak or defiant.
